front.div:
Abstract: In this contribution a possibility of electrochemical production of chlorine for water disinfection,
by using photovoltaic panels from solar energy, is described. A simple way of chloride production by
means of a photovoltaic panel, comparable with classical electrical power source was performed on an
experimental device. By using photovoltaic panel with nominal output 50 W and solar irrigation 380 –
550 W/m
2 chlorine production was 0.3 mg/min, which represents amount of chlorine sufficient for
disinfections of approximately 4000 l water per day.
front.keyword: Key words: chlorine production, disinfection of water, solar energy, photovoltaic panel
